Class AccessoryExtension

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    NUR accessory extension.

      • setBarcodeDecodingScheme

        public void setBarcodeDecodingScheme(java.lang.String charsetToUse)
        Set the barcode interpretation character set.
        Parameters:
        charsetToUse - Character set as a string e.g. "UTF-8", "Shift_JIS", "IBM855" (IBM Cyrillic) etc.
        See Also:
        getBarcodeDecodingScheme(),

      • getBarcodeDecodingScheme

        public java.lang.String getBarcodeDecodingScheme()
        Get the current character set used for barcode decoding.
        Returns:
        Return the character set as a string such as "UTF-8", "Shift_JS" etc.

      • restartBLEModuleToDFU

        public void restartBLEModuleToDFU()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Restart the BLE module to DFU (Device Firmware Upgrade) mode. After the call, another application or built-in updater can upgrade the BLE module's FW.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Can throw I/O, timeout or API related exception based on the occurred error.

                           byte calDistanceMillimeter)

      • isNotSupportedError

        public boolean isNotSupportedError(int error)
        Can be used to detect whether the accessory module reported the barcodereader not being present.
        Parameters:
        error - The error code received from the barcode result event.
        Returns:
        Return true if the error code indicates the barcode reader not being present.
        See Also:
        BARCODE_READER_NOT_PRESENT_ERROR

      • imagerCmd

        public byte[] imagerCmd(java.lang.String cmd,
                        ACC_IMAGER_TYPE type)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Imager configuration command.
        Parameters:
        cmd - Configuration command as string. See Imager manual for details of commands
        type - Type of imager 0=Opticon
        Returns:
        Response from imager as byte array. See documentation of imager.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Can throw I/O, timeout or API related exception based on the occurred error.
        See Also:
        ACC_IMAGER_TYPE

      • getWirelessChargeStatus

        Returns:

        ACC_WIRELESS_CHARGE_STATUS

      • setWirelessCharge

        public ACC_WIRELESS_CHARGE_STATUS setWirelessCharge(boolean on)
        Set the wireless charging on or off.
        Parameters:
        on - Set to true to turn on the wireless charging.
        Returns:
        Returns the status of the operation, does not throw exception.
        See Also:
        ACC_WIRELESS_CHARGE_STATUS, getWirelessChargeStatus()

      • readBarcodeAsync

        public void readBarcodeAsync(int timeout)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Asynchronous (non-blocking) barcode scan. NOTE: calling this effectively prohibits other operations at the same time.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Scan timeout in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Can throw exception if an error occurred in APi's transport.
        See Also:
        cancelBarcodeAsync()

      • getFwVersion

        public AccVersionInfo getFwVersion()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the BLE module's FW version.
        Returns:
        When successful, returns the 3-digit FW version dot separted as in A.B.C.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Can throw I/O, timeout or API related exception based on the occurred error.
        See Also:
        makeIntegerVersion(String)

      • splitByChar

        public static java.lang.String[] splitByChar(java.lang.String stringToSplit,
                                             char separator,
                                             boolean removeEmpty)
        Split a string to a string array based on give character. Can be used e.g. to split comma or semicolon separated string to multiple fields.
        Parameters:
        stringToSplit - The separated string
        separator - Separating character e.g. ',', ';', ':' etc.
        removeEmpty - If true then the empty fields are removed.
        Returns:
        Returns an arrays of strings split from the single string. The strings are trimmed i.e. whitespace is removed.

      • splitByChar

        public static java.lang.String[] splitByChar(java.lang.String stringToSplit,
                                             char separator)
        Split a string to a string array based on give character. Can be used e.g. to split comma or semicolon separated string to multiple fields. Empty string are removed.
        Parameters:
        stringToSplit - The separated string
        separator - Separating character e.g. ',', ';', ':' etc.
        Returns:
        Returns an arrays of strings split from the single string. The strings are trimmed i.e. whitespace is removed.

      • makeIntegerVersion

        public int makeIntegerVersion(java.lang.String strVersion)
        Converts the FW version from format A.B.C to an integer that can be used to compare versions as numbers.
        Parameters:
        strVersion - Version in correct format like 1.2.3.
        Returns:
        When successful, an integer reprentation of the version string is returned. In case of parsing errors -1 is returned.

      • cancelBarcodeAsync

        public void cancelBarcodeAsync()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Cancels an ongoing asynchronous barcode scan. NOTE: the scan is canceled by a single byte sent to the extension module.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Can throw exception if an error occurred in APi's transport.
        See Also:
        readBarcodeAsync(int)

      • vibrate

        public void vibrate(int length_ms,
                    int nTimes)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Use device's vibra.
        Parameters:
        length_ms - Vibration on time in ms; pause in between will be the same.
        nTimes - Number of times to repeat. Total time must not exceed 2000ms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Can throw exception if an error occurred in APi's transport.
        See Also:
        vibrate(int)
